title: Ticket #5047: Improve CE requirements for blahp
description:
Currently, the blahp parses the bizarre cerequirements attribute: 

remote_cerequirements = foo == X && bar == Y && ...

which sets the environment variables: 

foo=X
bar=Y

when it executes the blahp's local attributes script.

This is a real strange way to pass along variables, especially considering the presence of sub-classads! I propose we add a new attribute, SubmitAttributes. This will be a sub-classad; the (case-preserved) attributes will become environment variable names whose value is set to the classad attribute's evaluated value.

This will allow something like: 

remote_submitattributes = [foo="X"; bar="Y"];

which feels more natural.
